metadata.title: Journal Pre-proof Contamination-free visual detection of SARS-CoV-2 with CRISPR/Cas12a: A promising method in the point-of-care detection Contamination-free visual detection of SARS-CoV-2 with CRISPR/Cas12a: A 1 promising method in the point-of-care detection 2

The reaction system contains 1× One Step 163 RT-PCR Buffer Ⅲ, 0.08 U/μL TaKaRa Ex Taq HS, 0.2 μM Forward Primer, 0.2 μM 164 Reverse Primer, 0.1 μM probe, 0.4 μL PrimeScript RT Enzyme Mix Ⅱ, 2 μL RNA 165 templates of different concentrations. body_text.text: A severe respiratory disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 was found in Wuhan, Hubei 61 province, China in December 2019 (Wu et al., 2020a) . The familial clustered cases 62 suggested that the virus could spread from person to person (Chan et al., 2020) .

During several weeks after the novel coronavirus were found, the virus spread rapidly 64 in China. A few months later, the virus spread around the world. As of 31st May 2020, 65 according to public data from Johns Hopkins University, more than 6 million 66 confirmed cases and 360 thousand deaths were reported in the worldwide. It was 67 found that the infectivity of SARS-CoV-2 peaked during the incubation period, which 68 may cause many clustered cases (He et al., 2020) . Diagnosis of COVID-19 in time is 69 effective for tracking and controlling the epidemic. The commonly used testing 70 methods for virus detection include immunoassays and nucleic acid detection.

However, for immunoassays, it was difficult to detect blood samples from patients in 72 the incubation and early infection period by immunoassays. Cross-reaction with other 73 similar coronaviruses may also affect the specificity of immunoassays (Lee et al., 74 2020). Therefore, immunoassays could not be used as the only basis but a supplement 75 for the diagnosis and exclusion of COVID-19. It could just be used as. qRT-PCR was 76 the gold standard for SARS-CoV-2 detection extracted from throat or nasal swabs 77 (Wu et al., 2020c) . The characteristic sequence information of SARS-CoV-2 could be

For RT-LAMP reaction, thermo-cycling process is not required and the reaction time 88 is also shorter than qRT-PCR (Estrela et al., 2019 (Kim et al., 2020) . Based on the 221 sequencing and transcriptome analysis, we selected three gene fragments, ORF gene, 222 N gene and E gene were selected for detection (Fig. 1) . A rapid, reliable and 29 specific detection method was urgently needed. Herein, we reported a30 contamination-free visual detection method of for SARS-CoV-2 with LAMP and 31 CRISPR/Cas12a technology. CRISPR/Cas12a reagents were pre-added on the inner 32 wall of the centrifuge tube lid. After LAMP nucleic acid reaction of the sample, 33 CRISPR/Cas12a reagents were centrifuged flowed into the tube and mixed with 34 amplicon solution by hand shaking, which can effectively avoid possible amplicon 35 formed aerosol contamination caused by re-opening the lid after amplification. the 36 amplification reaction liquid. which was also safer for the operators. The positive 37 samples would CRISPR/Cas12a can highly specific recognize target sequence and 38 discriminately cleave single strand DNA probes (5'-6FAM 3'-BHQ1). The 39 fluorescence signal would be produced by the recognition and cleavage of. With smart 40 phone and portable 3D printing instrument, the produced fluorescence can be seen by 41 naked eyes without any dedicated instruments, which is promising in the point-of-care 42 detection. The whole amplification and detection process could be completed within 43 40 min with high sensitivity of 20 copies RNA of SARS-CoV-2. This reaction had 44 high specificity and could avoid cross-reactivity with other common viruses such as 45 influenza virus. For 7 positive and 3 negative respiratory swab samples provided by 46 Zhejiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention, our detection results 47 had 100% positive agreement and 100% negative agreement, which demonstrated the 48 accuracy and application prospect of this method.

FIGREF1.text: 78 obtained by gene sequencing and bioinformatics analysis. COVID-19 could be 79 diagnosed by detecting specific nucleic acid sequence of SARS-CoV-2. However, 80 qRT-PCR requires repeated heat and cold process with bulky and expensive 81 equipment. The complex operation steps of qRT-PCR nucleic acid testing must be 82 done by the special labs or hospitals, which is difficult to detect a large number of 83 samples in such a short time. For some low-resource areas, diagnosis of COVID-19 84 by qRT-PCR is more difficult. The spread of the virus could not be effectively 85 monitored and controlled without timely diagnosis. A fast, accurate and portable 86 point-of-care device for SARS-CoV-2 detection was urgently needed.

FIGREF2.text: the spread of the global epidemic, more rapid and convenient detection 101 methods are being explored. Based on CRISPR system and lateral flow assays, 102 Broughton et al. reported a rapid method that could detect SARS-CoV-2 within 40 103 min. Firstly, Extracted the RNA from the respiratory swab sample Secondly, amplify 104 the extracted RNA were amplified by RT-LAMP. Then the tube was open and 105 CRISPR/Cas12 reagents were added into the amplicon solution. Finally the detection 106 results were read out by inserting lateral flow strips into the tube (Broughton et al., 107 2020). This detection method stepped further towards point-of-care testing. However, 108 this method also had some drawbacks. The operators must open the lid for lateral flow 109 assays after nucleic acid amplification. However, after LAMP amplification the 110 concentration of the target nucleic acids in the tube was very high. The amplicons 111 may form aerosol contamination when re-opening the lid, which was a serious 112 problem for nucleic acid detection. PCR has been widely used in molecular diagnosis 113 since it was first published. The limited studies showed that in the next two decades 114 false-positive rates in the laboratory was 9-57% because of contamination (Borst et 115 al., 2004). Due to high sensitivity of nucleic acid amplification such as PCR and 116 LAMP, DNA fragments from the previous experiments may be re-amplified, causing 117 the false positive results of the next detection (Mukama et al., 2020). To prevent 118 amplicons formed aerosol contamination, our research group had done some work 119 based on CRISPR/Cas technology (Qian et al., 2019; Wu et al., 2020b). 120 Here, we reported a contamination-free visual method for SARS-CoV-2 detection 121 with CRISPR/Cas12a. In order to prevent aerosol contamination, we did not need to 122 open the tube again after amplification process. Having extracted RNA from 123 respiratory throat swab sample to be tested, RT-LAMP reagents were added in the 124 centrifuge tube. Mineral oil was added to cover the RT-LAMP reagents, which could 125 prevent volatilization of reaction solution and diffusion of amplicons. The upper 126 surface of the amplification reaction solution was covered with a layer of mineral oil. 127 CRISPR/Cas12a reaction liquid was pre-added on the inner wall of the centrifuge tube 128 lid. When Even if the lid was closed, the CRISPR/Cas12a reagents would not drip 129 because of the surface tension. The centrifuge tube was put at the isothermal condition 130 to complete RT-LAMP reaction. Then centrifuge shaking the tube to make the pre-added CRISPR/Cas12a reagents flow into it rather than re-open the tube put in the 3D printing instrument and the fluorescent signal could be seen 136 by the naked eyes with the smart phone. We have demonstrated this method had high 137 specificity and could prevent cross-reaction with other common viruses such as 138 influenza virus. By covering a layer of mineral oil and pre-adding CRISPR reagents, 139 the possible amplicon formed aerosol contamination could be effectively prevented. 140 Combined with the portable 3D printing instrument, the detection results could be 141 judged by producing fluorescence or not. No bulky and expensive instruments were 142 needed in the whole testing process. We anticipate this detection method is promising 143 in the point-of-care detection for SARS-CoV-RNA templates samples were purchased from synthesized 148 commercially by Genewell Gene Technology Co., Ltd, (Shenzhen, China). The real virus SARS-CoV-2 samples were 151 extracted and provided by Zhejiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and 152 Prevention. They were Conoravirus 229E, 202 Conoravirus NL63, Conoravirus OC43, Conoravirus HKU1, Influenza virus A (FluA)and Prevention). The nucleic acid purification, RT-LAMP, CRISPR 208 reaction were done. Two thirds of the viral 217 genome RNA sequence were open reading frames (ORF). It was reported that the 218 structural proteins of SARS-CoV-2 include the envelope protein (encoded by E gene), 219 the membrane protein (encoded by M gene), the nucleocapsid protein (encoded by N 220 gene) and the spike protein (encoded by S gene)

For detection of these three genes, 254 the higher the detection concentration, the better the repeatability of the experiment. 255 When the concentration of the target RNA was as low as 2 copies, real time 256 RT-LAMP assays had no stable fluorescent signal. so we selected ORF gene was 257 selected for the next CRISPR/Cas based visual detection. The detection of ORF gene 258 real time RT-LAMP reaction could be completed within 40 minutes at 65℃. Although 259 the LOD of the real time RT-LAMP assays was an order of magnitude lower than that 260 of qRT-PCR, the advantage of the RT-LAMP assays was that it did not require 261 repeated heating and cooling process. FIGREF5.text: The visual detection of real samples of SARS-CoV-2 312 To demonstrate the feasibility of our method in practical application, we detected 10 313 real samples provided by Zhejiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and 314 Prevention were detected, of which 7 positive samples and 3 negative samples. ORF 315 gene was the target fragments for detection. For these 7 positive samples, the Ct 316 values of qRT-PCR were 33, 29.2, 31.4, 34.2, 33.5, 33.4, 35.4. We detected these 317 positive samples with our contamination-free visual detection method. These real 318 samples were detected using our contamination-free visual detection method. As you 319 could see the pictures in Fig. 5, 7 positive samples all produced green fluorescence 320 (left) and the no template control (right) did not produce green fluorescence. also detect it accurately, indicating that our method had high sensitivity 326 even if the number of target RNA in the real sample was relatively small. Also, the 327 entire process did not need to open the lid, which could effectively avoid false 328 positive results caused by aerosol contamination. The entire operation The detection results of 7 positive and 3 negative real respiratory swab samples. For 332 each picture, on the left side of each picture was sample to be detected and On the right a contamination-free visual method for SARS-CoV-2 detection with 337 CRISPR/Cas12a. By covering mineral oil on LAMP solution and pre-adding 338 amplification and detection CRISPR reagents in the centrifuge tube lid at once time, 339 the entire process did not require opening the lid again, which could effectively avoid 340 the false positive caused by amplicon formed aerosol contamination. It would also be 341 more friendly to the experimenters. The RT-LAMP amplification reaction did not 342 involve repeated heating and cooling process, greatly reducing the dependence on 343 thermal-cycling instrument.
